State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. Mubarak's son [[Gamal Mubarak|Gamal]] also resigned as Assistant Secretary and Secretary of the Policy Committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/02/05/136363.html |title=Ø¥ÙØµØ§Ø¡ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ´Ø±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙÙØ·ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù.. They called on the protesters to continue at Tahrir Square every Tuesday and Friday until Mubarak "resigns and makes true the demands of the people."<ref name="CNN 5 Feb"/>

==== 6 February â Sunday of martyrs ====
â
During the night of 5â6 February, some protesters continued to camp out in Tahrir Square, while Alexandria also had peaceful late night protests. However, gunfire rang out in the early hours of the day in Cairo.<ref name="aljazlive"/>

During the night of 5â6 February, some protesters continued to camp out in Tahrir Square, while Alexandria also had peaceful late night protests. However, gunfire rang out in the early hours of the day in Cairo.<ref name="aljazlive"/> The same organisers of the "Day of Anger", "Friday of Anger", "March of the Millions" and "Friday of Departure" called for a protest all over Egypt on 4 February, which was dubbed the "'''Sunday of martyrs'''" ({{lang-ar|Ø£Ø­Ø¯ Ø§ÙØ´ÙØ¯Ø§Ø¡}})
